DataElement.preferredName: Pediatric Unable to Perform Pulmonary Function Test Oxygen Saturation Measurement Room Air Greater Than 95 Percentage Outcome Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the oxygen saturation in room air was greater than 95% when pediatric pulmonary function tests were unable to be performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pediatric Unable to Perform Pulmonary Function Test Oxygen Saturation Measurement Room Air Greater Than 95 Percentage Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having to do with children._An indication that an action, task, or function was not done due to a lack of skill, means, or opportunity._A broad range of tests that are performed to assess how well lungs inhale and exhale air and how efficiently they transfer oxygen into the blood._The measurement of the ratio of oxygenated hemoglobin to total hemoglobin in the blood._Unmodified air as existing in the immediate surroundings._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::95_A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Pediatric Unable to Perform Pulmonary Function Test Oxygen Saturation Measurement
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with children.:An indication that an action, task, or function was not done due to a lack of skill, means, or opportunity.:A broad range of tests that are performed to assess how well lungs inhale and exhale air and how efficiently they transfer oxygen into the blood.:The measurement of the ratio of oxygenated hemoglobin to total hemoglobin in the blood.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with children.
An indication that an action, task, or function was not done due to a lack of skill, means, or opportunity.
A broad range of tests that are performed to assess how well lungs inhale and exhale air and how efficiently they transfer oxygen into the blood.
The measurement of the ratio of oxygenated hemoglobin to total hemoglobin in the blood.

Property.preferredName: Room Air Greater Than Integer::95 Percentage Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: Unmodified air as existing in the immediate surroundings.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::95:A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: Unmodified air as existing in the immediate surroundings.
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
The result of an action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
